x-enumDescriptions.message.output_text.logprobs: includes sampled logprobs in assistant messages.
x-enumDescriptions.reasoning.encrypted_content: includes encrypted reasoning content so that it may be rehydrated on a subsequent request.

type.description: The tool to call. Always `function`.

name.description: The name of the function tool to call.

x-enumDescriptions.auto: Let the model choose the tools from among the provided set.
x-enumDescriptions.none: Restrict the model from calling any tools.
x-enumDescriptions.required: Require the model to call a tool.

type.description: The tool choice type. Always `allowed_tools`.

tools.description: The list of tools that are permitted for this request.

allOf.description: How to select a tool from the allowed set.

ToolChoiceParam.description: Controls which tool the model should use, if any.

MetadataParam.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be         useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured         format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.
        Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings         with a maximum length of 512 characters.

x-enumDescriptions.high: Instruct the model to emit more verbose final responses.
x-enumDescriptions.low: Instruct the model to emit less verbose final responses.
x-enumDescriptions.medium: Use the model's default verbosity setting.

format.description: The format configuration for text output.

allOf.description: Controls the level of detail in generated text output.

include_obfuscation.description: Whether to obfuscate sensitive information in streamed output. Defaults to `true`.

StreamOptionsParam.description: Options that control streamed response behavior.

x-enumDescriptions.high: Use a higher reasoning effort to improve answer quality.
x-enumDescriptions.low: Use a lower reasoning effort for faster responses.
x-enumDescriptions.minimal: Use the lowest non-zero reasoning effort.
x-enumDescriptions.none: Restrict the model from performing any reasoning before emitting a final answer.
x-enumDescriptions.xhigh: Use the maximum reasoning effort available.

x-enumDescriptions.auto: Allow the model to decide when to summarize.
x-enumDescriptions.concise: Emit concise summaries of reasoning content.
x-enumDescriptions.detailed: Emit details summaries of reasoning content.

anyOf.description: Controls the level of reasoning effort the model should apply. Higher effort may increase latency and cost.

allOf.description: Controls whether the response includes a reasoning summary.

ReasoningParam.description: **gpt-5 and o-series models only** Configuration options for [reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).

x-enumDescriptions.auto: Let the service decide how to truncate.
x-enumDescriptions.disabled: Disable service truncation. Context over the model's context limit will result in a 400 error.

x-enumDescriptions.auto: Choose a service tier automatically based on current account state.

anyOf.description: The model to use for this request, e.g. 'gpt-5.2'.
Context to provide to the model for the scope of this request. May either be a string or an array of input items. If a string is provided, it is interpreted as a user message.
The ID of the response to use as the prior turn for this request.
A list of tools that the model may call while generating the response.

allOf.description: Controls which tool the model should use, if any.

Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be         useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured         format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.
        Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings         with a maximum length of 512 characters.
Configuration options for text output.

anyOf.description: Sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values make the output more random.
Nucleus sampling parameter, between 0 and 1. The model considers only the tokens with the top cumulative probability.
Penalizes new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far.
Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency in the text so far.
Whether the model may call multiple tools in parallel.

stream.description: Whether to stream response events as server-sent events.

allOf.description: Options that control streamed response behavior.

background.description: Whether to run the request in the background and return immediately.

anyOf.description: The maximum number of tokens the model may generate for this response.
The maximum number of tool calls the model may make while generating the response.

allOf.description: Configuration options for reasoning behavior.

anyOf.description: A stable identifier used for safety monitoring and abuse detection.
A key to use when reading from or writing to the prompt cache.

allOf.description: Controls how the service truncates the input when it exceeds the model context window.

anyOf.description: Additional instructions to guide the model for this request.

store.description: Whether to store the response so it can be retrieved later.

allOf.description: The service tier to use for this request.

anyOf.description: The number of most likely tokens to return at each position, along with their log probabilities.

reason.description: The reason the response could not be completed.

IncompleteDetails.title: Incomplete details
IncompleteDetails.description: Details about why the response was incomplete.

x-enumDescriptions.developer: Developer-supplied guidance that shapes the assistant’s behavior.
x-enumDescriptions.system: System-level instructions that set global behavior.

x-enumDescriptions.low: Restricts the model to a lower-resolution version of the image.

x-enumDescriptions.completed: Model has finished sampling this item.
x-enumDescriptions.in_progress: Model is currently sampling this item.
x-enumDescriptions.incomplete: Model was interrupted from sampling this item partway through. This can occur, for example, if the model encounters a stop token or exhausts its output_token budget.

id.description: The unique ID of the message.

FunctionCallOutput.description: A function tool call output that was returned by the tool.

type.description: The type of the item. Always `reasoning`.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

anyOf.description: A description of the function. Used by the model to determine whether or not to call the function.
A JSON schema object describing the parameters of the function.
Whether to enforce strict parameter validation. Default `true`.

FunctionTool.title: Function
FunctionTool.description: Defines a function in your own code the model can choose to call. Learn more about [function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling).

Tool.description: A tool that can be used to generate a response.

anyOf.description: The reasoning effort that was requested for the model, if specified.

allOf.description: A model-generated summary of its reasoning that was produced, if available.

Reasoning.title: Reasoning
Reasoning.description: Reasoning configuration and metadata that were used for the response.

cached_tokens.description: The number of input tokens that were served from cache.

InputTokensDetails.title: Input tokens details
InputTokensDetails.description: A breakdown of input token usage that was recorded.

reasoning_tokens.description: The number of output tokens that were attributed to reasoning.

OutputTokensDetails.title: Output tokens details
OutputTokensDetails.description: A breakdown of output token usage that was recorded.

input_tokens.description: The number of input tokens that were used to generate the response.

output_tokens.description: The number of output tokens that were generated by the model.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens that were used.

allOf.description: A breakdown of input token usage that was recorded.
A breakdown of output token usage that was recorded.

Usage.title: Usage

id.description: The unique ID of the response that was created.

object.description: The object type, which was always `response`.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the response was created.

anyOf.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the response was completed, if it was completed.

status.description: The status that was set for the response.

allOf.description: Details about why the response was incomplete, if applicable.

model.description: The model that generated this response.

anyOf.description: The ID of the previous response in the chain that was referenced, if any.
Additional instructions that were used to guide the model for this response.

output.description: The output items that were generated by the model.

allOf.description: The error that occurred, if the response failed.

tools.description: The tools that were available to the model during response generation.

allOf.description: How the input was truncated by the service when it exceeded the model context window.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether the model was allowed to call multiple tools in parallel.

allOf.description: Configuration options for text output that were used.

top_p.description: The nucleus sampling parameter that was used for this response.

presence_penalty.description: The presence penalty that was used to penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far.

frequency_penalty.description: The frequency penalty that was used to penalize new tokens based on their frequency in the text so far.

top_logprobs.description: The number of most likely tokens that were returned at each position, along with their log probabilities.

temperature.description: The sampling temperature that was used for this response.

allOf.description: Reasoning configuration and outputs that were produced for this response.
Token usage statistics that were recorded for the response, if available.

anyOf.description: The maximum number of tokens the model was allowed to generate for this response.
The maximum number of tool calls the model was allowed to make while generating the response.

store.description: Whether this response was stored so it can be retrieved later.

background.description: Whether this request was run in the background.

service_tier.description: The service tier that was used for this response.

metadata.description: Developer-defined metadata that was associated with the response.

anyOf.description: A stable identifier that was used for safety monitoring and abuse detection.
A key that was used to read from or write to the prompt cache.

content_index.description: The index of the output text content that was updated.

annotation_index.description: The index of the annotation that was added.

allOf.description: An annotation that applies to a span of output text.

ResponseOutputTextAnnotationAddedStreami.title: Response output text annotation added event
ResponseOutputTextAnnotationAddedStreami.description: A streaming event that indicated an output text annotation was added.

type.description: The type of the event, always `response.function_call_arguments.delta`.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of the event that was emitted.

item_id.description: The ID of the tool call item that was updated.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that was updated.

delta.description: The arguments delta that was appended.

obfuscation.description: An obfuscation string that was added to pad the event payload.

ResponseFunctionCallArgumentsDeltaStream.title: Response function call arguments delta event
ResponseFunctionCallArgumentsDeltaStream.description: A streaming event that indicated function call arguments were incrementally added.

type.description: The type of the event, always `response.function_call_arguments.done`.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of the event that was emitted.

item_id.description: The ID of the tool call item that was updated.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that was updated.

arguments.description: The final arguments string that was emitted.

ResponseFunctionCallArgumentsDoneStreami.title: Response function call arguments done event
ResponseFunctionCallArgumentsDoneStreami.description: A streaming event that indicated function call arguments were completed.

type.description: The error type that was emitted.

anyOf.description: The error code that was emitted, if any.

message.description: The human-readable error message that was emitted.

anyOf.description: The parameter name that was associated with the error, if any.

additionalProperties.description: The header value that was emitted.

headers.description: The response headers that were emitted with the error, if any.

ErrorPayload.title: Error payload
ErrorPayload.description: An error payload that was emitted for a streaming error event.

type.description: The type of the event, always `error`.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of the event that was emitted.

allOf.description: The error payload that was emitted.

ErrorStreamingEvent.title: Error event
ErrorStreamingEvent.description: A streaming event that indicated an error was emitted.

InputVideoContent.description: A content block representing a video input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input content. Always `input_video`.

video_url.description: A base64 or remote url that resolves to a video file.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always `json_schema`.

description.description:
A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to
determine how to respond in the format.

name.description:
The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain
underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.title: JSON schema
schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

anyOf.description:
Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output.
If set to true, the model will always follow the exact schema defined
in the `schema` field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when
`strict` is `true`.
